meanings.definition: Capable of being appeased or pacified.
meanings.sent1: The angry customer was placable after receiving a refund.
meanings.sent2: She is a placable person who always tries to find a peaceful solution.
meanings.sent3: The placable cat forgave its owner for accidentally stepping on its tail.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds seemed placable as the sun slowly emerged from behind them.
meanings.sent5: His placable nature made him a favorite among his colleagues.

meanings.definition: Willing to forgive or make peace.
meanings.sent1: Despite the argument, she remained placable and extended an olive branch.
meanings.sent2: The placable neighbor quickly resolved the dispute over the property line.
meanings.sent3: The placable child easily forgave his friend for breaking his toy.
meanings.sent4: Her placable attitude turned a tense situation into a peaceful resolution.
meanings.sent5: The placable king pardoned the traitors and welcomed them back to the kingdom.
